intro: Racosperma leptoclada, commonly known as the slender-leaf acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves with slender, linear leaflets. Its flowers are usually yellow or cream in color, arranged in dense, globular clusters. Racosperma leptoclada is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species in harsh climates.
